skill.name: devops-runbooks
skill.description: Operational runbook and procedure documentation specialist. Use when creating incident response procedures, operational playbooks, or system maintenance guides.
skill.summary: Operational runbook and procedure documentation specialist. Use when creating incident response proc...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no command execution capabilities. Contains only markdown templates and documentation guidance.

content.value_statement: DevOps teams struggle to document critical procedures in a consistent, actionable format. This skill provides structured templates and guidance for creating comprehensive runbooks that include incident response, troubleshooting steps, rollback procedures, and escalation paths.
actual_capabilities: Creates operational runbook documentation with standardized structure
Defines rollback and recovery procedures for each step
Provides troubleshooting guides for common error scenarios
Structures escalation paths with contact information
Captures prerequisites, credentials, and access requirements
limitations: Does not execute any commands or scripts
Does not access external systems or APIs
Does not provide real-time monitoring or alerting

use_cases.title: Document SRE Procedures
use_cases.description: Create standardized runbooks for on-call procedures, incident response, and system recovery.

use_cases.title: Capture Operational Knowledge
use_cases.description: Document deployment procedures, maintenance windows, and system changes for team knowledge transfer.

use_cases.title: Build Troubleshooting Guides
use_cases.description: Create actionable troubleshooting guides with decision trees for common customer-facing issues.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Runbook
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a runbook for [PROCEDURE_NAME] on [SERVICE_NAME]. Include: overview with purpose, prerequisites with required access, step-by-step procedure with verification, rollback steps, and troubleshooting for common issues.

prompt_templates.title: Incident Response
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an incident response runbook for [INCIDENT_TYPE] affecting [SERVICE_NAME]. Include severity levels, initial assessment steps, containment procedures, communication templates, and escalation paths by timeline.

prompt_templates.title: Maintenance Window
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a maintenance runbook for [MAINTENANCE_TASK] on [SYSTEM_NAME]. Include pre-maintenance checks, maintenance steps with commands, expected outputs, post-maintenance verification, and rollback if issues occur.

prompt_templates.title: Escalation Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an escalation matrix for [SERVICE_NAME] incidents. Define trigger conditions, response time expectations, L1/L2/L3 contact paths, handoff procedures, and communication templates for each escalation level.

output_examples.input: Create a runbook for database failover on the primary PostgreSQL cluster
output:
## Overview
- Purpose: Recover from primary database outage
- When to use: Primary instance unresponsive or corrupted
- Expected duration: 5-10 minutes

## Prerequisites
- Access to AWS console
- VPN access to VPC
- PostgreSQL admin credentials

best_practices: Include copy-pasteable commands with expected outputs for every step
Define rollback procedures at each major step, not just at the end
Test runbooks quarterly and update based on recent incidents
anti_patterns: Using placeholders without clear instructions for what to replace
Skipping verification steps after critical operations
Failing to document escalation criteria and contact information

faq.question: What platforms is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses standard markdown formatting compatible with any documentation system.

faq.question: How detailed should runbook steps be?
faq.answer: Each step should be actionable by someone with basic familiarity. Include exact commands and expected outputs.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my documentation system?
faq.answer: Yes. The markdown output can be exported to Confluence, Notion, GitBook, or any markdown-compatible platform.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill that does not store, transmit, or access any external data or systems.

faq.question: Why are my runbooks not executing?
faq.answer: This skill creates documentation only. It does not execute commands. Run automated procedures with separate CI/CD or scripting tools.

faq.question: How does this compare to Ansible or Terraform?
faq.answer: This skill creates human-readable documentation. Use Ansible, Terraform, or similar tools for automated infrastructure execution.
